summary: The Federal Workforce Freedom Act, introduced in the Senate, aims to prohibit federal employees from joining or participating in labor unions for collective bargaining or representation. It defines key terms like 'collective bargaining agreement,' 'Federal agency,' 'Federal employee,' and 'labor union.'  The bill mandates the termination of existing collective bargaining agreements and the dismissal of related proceedings.  It also repeals Chapter 71 of title 5 of the United States Code.
